title: God’s Dice review, Soho Theatre, review: just might convert doubters to David Baddiel
text:
David Baddiel has been branching out lately. Alongside making TV documentaries about his father and the Holocaust, last year the comedian tried his hand at a children’s book, and now, at 55, he’s written his first play. As it happens, it’s a piece about a middle-aged man who risks his professional reputation by trying something new.

In God’s Dice, that man is Dr Henry Brook, a physics professor at Exeter University. He’s a rumpled, put-upon, altogether Alan Davies-ish type – played, appropriately enough, by Alan Davies. It’s an entertaining but not groundbreaking performance; Davies is oddly overshadowed by a strong supporting cast (EastEnders’s Nitin Ganatra is particularly good fun as Henry’s...
description: David Baddiel has been branching out lately.
